title: Hyro Launches Proactive Px™ with AI Agent to Help Healthcare Organizations Handle Coverage Disruption Caused by OBBBA
description: Hyro, the leader in responsible AI agents for healthcare, today announced the launch of Proactive Px™, their outbound patient experience platform, featuring a free component for assisting with expected coverage disruption caused by The One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA). Proactive Px™ will enable health systems to move beyond reactive contact center calls, engaging patients proactively through outbound voice and SMS AI agents that deliver quick and convenient access to care. content:
The complementary AI agent will conduct first-of-its-kind automated outreach on behalf of health systems via voice and SMS for ACA Re-Enrollment & Medicaid Redetermination (ARMR™)—driving patient awareness, successful re-enrollment, and protected revenue.

NEW YORK, Sept. 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Hyro, the leader in responsible AI agents for healthcare, today announced the launch of Proactive Px™, their outbound patient experience platform, featuring a free component for assisting with expected coverage disruption caused by The One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA). Proactive Px™ will enable health systems to move beyond reactive contact center calls, engaging patients proactively through outbound voice and SMS AI agents that deliver quick and convenient access to care. Health systems will be able to launch intelligent outbound campaigns featuring appointment and referral reminders, billing support and Rx management, that drive better operational efficiency, improved patient outcomes and maximized revenue.

As part of the Proactive Px™ launch, Hyro is offering a complimentary AI agent, ARMR™ (ACA Re-Enrollment & Medicaid Redetermination), to health systems across the U.S. to proactively address upcoming operational challenges caused by OBBBA. Starting in November 2025, OBBBA is expected to trigger some of the most significant coverage disruptions in over a decade, with up to 10 million Americans projected to lose health insurance, including 7.5 million Medicaid enrollees, 2 million ACA marketplace members, and millions more who will face higher premiums and more frequent eligibility checks, making it harder to stay insured.

The projected impact to the financial security of health systems as a direct result of OBBBA are significant: $204 billion in uncompensated care over the next decade, including $63 billion in direct hospital impact, with rural providers expected to be hit especially hard. Without proactive action, the result will be treatment interruptions, delayed care, worsening chronic conditions, and severe financial strain.

Hyro's ARMR™ Outreach, already being implemented for their current client roster, is built to help healthcare organizations get ahead now, with the aim of keeping more patients informed and insured, and protecting care continuity. Health systems will be able to create and automate workflows around awareness for incoming changes surrounding the Affordable Care Act and Medicaid, messaging and calling patients who are at risk of being affected by coverage changes or who need to re-enroll. For ARMR™ Outreach, the infrastructure and onboarding are provided at no cost, with third party API calls covered by clients to ensure that the solution remains sustainable and available to as many health systems and patients as possible.
summary: Hyro, the leader in responsible AI agents for healthcare, has launched Proactive Px™, their outbound patient experience platform, which includes a free component for assisting with coverage disruption caused by The One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA). The platform will provide first-of-its-kind automated outreach on behalf of health systems via voice and SMS for ACA Re-Enrollment & Medicaid Redetermination (ARMR™), driving patient awareness, successful re-enrollment, and increased revenue. As part of the launch, Hyro is offering a complimentary AI agent, ARMR™, to health systems across the U.S. for help in addressing upcoming operational challenges caused by OBBBA. The projected impact on health systems will reach $204 billion over the next decade, including $63 billion in direct hospital impact.
shortSummary: Hyro has launched Proactive Px™, an AI-based platform, to assist healthcare systems anticipate coverage disruptions and enhance operational efficiency and revenue.
argos_summary: Hyro has launched Proactive Px™, an outbound patient experience platform that uses AI voice and SMS agents to proactively engage patients on behalf of health systems. The platform includes a free component, ARMR™, designed to address coverage disruptions from the upcoming One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), which is expected to cause significant insurance loss and uncompensated care costs. By automating outreach for ACA re‑enrollment and Medicaid redetermination, Hyro aims to improve operational efficiency, patient outcomes, and revenue protection for U.S. health providers.
